q: What is the mass of a proton in kilograms?

Materials Science and Engineering studies the relationships between the ________ and ________ of materials.
The ________ of a material depends on how it's processed.
A material's ________ is due to its properties.
Metals contain a combination of one or more ________ elements and ________ elements.
Metals typically have a(n) ________ and ________ atomic arrangement.
The ________ electrons in metals allow them to be good conductors of electricity and heat.
Metals generally have poor ________ clarity for visible light.
Ceramics are compounds of ________ and ________.
Ceramics typically display ________ properties.
Ceramics are often used for ________ purposes, such as crowns.
Polymers are made primarily of ________ and ________.
Polymers are often referred to as '________ ________ ________'.
Polymers exhibit low ________ conductivities.
The properties of polymers change greatly at ________ ranges.
________ are blends of materials that are either from the same or different categories.
________ are intermediates of electrical conductors and insulators.
________ are normally implanted into the body and must be biocompatible.
________ materials have the ability to sense environmental stimuli.
________ are the only material category classified due to size.
The ________ of a material involves its preparation, either through synthesis or mixing.
The ________ of a material will determine how it behaves and the results of characterization.
Material ________ include mechanical, electrical, thermal, magnetic, optical, and deteriorative characteristics.
The ________ of a material is dependent on the start-to-finish process of its preparation and characterization.
In the atomic model, electrons are only able to move from one orbital to another, so they are ________.
The wave-mechanical model accounts for electron-electron ________ and electron-nucleus ________.
In the wave-mechanical model, orbitals are viewed as regions of ________.
The Principle Quantum Number (n) defines the ________ of the orbital.
The Azimuthal Quantum Number (l) is defined as the ________.
The Magnetic quantum number (m_i) determines the ________ of the orbital in space.
Electrons spin in ________ directions to maximize repulsion.
The periodic table is usually classified into metals, ________, and nonmetals.
An atom's electron configuration shows what kind of ________ we'll be working with.
Elements with high electronegativity are more likely to be ________ of electrons.
________ is an exception in electronegativity trends due to its half-filled orbital.
In d-block and f-block elements, ________ ________ causes more electrons to be inside rather than outside the atom.
The subshell corresponding to l = 0 is ________.
The subshell corresponding to l = 1 is ________.
The subshell corresponding to l = 2 is ________.
The subshell corresponding to l = 3 is ________.
The maximum number of electrons in an s subshell is ________.
The maximum number of electrons in a p subshell is ________.
The maximum number of electrons in a d subshell is ________.
The maximum number of electrons in an f subshell is ________.
